content: Let me help you out since you didn’t bother with a link! quote: Japanese Researchers Turn Cow Dung Into Fuel; Say Can Use Human Waste, Too Obihiro University of Agriculture and Veterinary Medicine Professor Junichi Takahashi and the Sumitomo Corporation research group (both in Japan) have jointly developed technology to produce hydrogen from cattle dung and urine for use in fuel cells. They say the same can be done with human waste. The researchers say the process allows for the production of hydrogen without producing unwanted carbon dioxide. Given its potential utility with human waste, the idea also may open pathways to household toilet technology: “toilet generators.” +http://sustainablog.org/2009/02/01/japanese-researchers-turn-cow-dung-into-fuel-say-can-use-human-waste-too/ quote: City of Flint and Swedish company to turn the city's human waste stream into fuel for vehicles and generating electricity FLINT, Michigan -- The city and a Swedish company plan to turn the city's human waste stream into fuel for powering vehicles or generating electricity. In the process, they say the partnership -- expected to be spelled out in further detail today at a City Hall news conference -- could make Flint a national leader in the biogas industry. The news comes as other fuel costs soar and worries over fossil fuels linger. "It's not that Swedes are smarter ... but if you pay $7, $8, $9 a gallon for gas, you get very creative. ... Swedes have learned," said Lennart N. Johansson, consul general for the Consulate General of Sweden in Detroit. Swedish Biogas International is based in Linkoping, Sweden, a city roughly the size of Flint. +http://www.mlive.com/environment/index.ssf/2008/05/city_of_flint_and_swedish_comp.html quote: Turning sewage into electricity Work has begun on a plant that will generate enough electricity to power around two thousand homes, from human waste. Northumbrian Water's anerobic digesters at Teesport, near Middlesbrough, will use bacteria to break down waste into fertiliser and methane gas. The methane will be used to fuel a power station on site. The plant treats 300,000 cubic metres of waste a day, equivalent to that produced by three million adults. +http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/7751500.stm

content: Any community with a waste treatment plant COULD capture the Methane and use it for fuel. Somehow or other, I don't think there'd be enough to run an electric arc steel/cast iron foundry, do you? Ever see rthe flaring of methane at old closed landfills? Methane from rotting organic waste. Just add water and oxygen, natures bacteria handle the rest. There's an even BETTER bacteria that gives off more complexed hydrocarbons that are similar to alch. It will, filtered, run a gasoline engine. So the D Rep is seeking a solution that's already been disovered. Saw her interview on the tube, a typical know nothing filibustering preposterous congressperson. During the Carter recession some farmers used poior quality, unsaleable corn as feed for making alch., ran their equipment on the alch., dried the exhausted mash , pelletized it and used it as cattle food. Others took their chicken/livestock waste and isolated the methane for use as fuel too. We have far too much government regulating the wrong things in the wrong ways. We need government at all levels reduced by 1/3 to 1/2 and rather than start in ways designed to "punish" citizens (you know, the parts that work, military, law enforcement, fire prorection, justice) thtey need to start by leaving 50% of their permitted apointments authorized VACANT. THAT ALONE WOULD SAVE TENS IF NOT HUNDRERDS OF BILLIONS ANNUALLY.
